clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetics of Paracetamol and Antiepileptic Drugs After Sleeve Gastrectomy
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Sleeve Gastroctomy on Pharmacokinetics of Paracetamol and Antiepileptic Drugs

brief_summary.textblock: Sleeve gastrectomy may affect drug pharmacokinetics in several potential ways. We will measure pharmakokinetics of paracetamol and antiepileptic drugs before and 6 months after sleeve gastrectomy.

detailed_description.textblock:
Sleeve gastrectomy may affect drug pharmacokinetics in several potential ways. We will measure pharmakokinetics of paracetamol (in consenting subjects that are undergoing sleeve gastrectomy) and antiepileptic drugs (in consenting subjects that are chronically treated by a stable dose) before and 6 months after sleeve gastrectomy in 10 subjects.
Blood tests will be taken for drug levels before and 4-8 times after the subject takes the drug. A pharmacokinetic curve will be calculated and compared for each subject between prior to surgery and after surgery.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: All participants will undergo blood tests for pharmacokinetic of paracetamol before and 6 months after sleeve gastrectomy

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic curve of paracetamol or antiepileptic drug: AUC
primary_outcome.description: sequential measurement of paracetamol or antiepileptic drug (carbamazepine, lamotrigine, phenytoin or valproic acid), AUC

arm_group.description: 10 participants will undergo measurement of paracetamol levels before and after sleeve gastrectomy

Up to 10 participants in each drug (up to 4 medications, total of up to 40 participants) will undergo measurement of levels of their chronic medication after a dose before and after sleeve gastrectomy

intervention.intervention_name: Antiepileptic (either carbamazepine, lamotrigine, phenytoin or valproic acid)
intervention.description: Single dose of antiepileptic drug (either carbamazepine, lamotrigine, phenytoin or valproic acid) for which the participant is taking chronically in stable dose

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. BMI over 30 and eligible for sleeve gastrectomy
2. Mentally capable for consent
3. (for the antiepileptic drug intervention) chronic stable treatment of antiepileptic drug
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Gastrointestinal illness impairing absorption
2. renal failure (glomerular filtration rate<45)
3. liver cirrhosis
4. heart failure (New York Heart Association class III or IV)
